org.grouplens.grapht.solver

Class DesireChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • org.grouplens.grapht.util.AbstractChain<Desire>
          • org.grouplens.grapht.solver.DesireChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<Desire>, Collection<Desire>, List<Desire>

    public class DesireChain
extends AbstractChain<Desire>
    A sequence of desires. When one desire is resolved, that resolution can be a desire that needs further resolution. These desires are accumulated in a desire chain. Desire chains are immutable; appending to one results in a new desire chain object pointing to the previous chain. They form a reverse singly linked list. The chain maintains O(1) access to both the initial and current desires.

    When iterating a desire chain the initial desire is first and the most recent desire is last.

    Since:
    0.7.0
    Author:
    GroupLens Research
    See Also:

      • getKey

        public Object getKey()
        Get this chain's key. Each chain has a key, a unique object that is created when the chain is created (via singleton(org.grouplens.grapht.reflect.Desire)), and preserved through extend(org.grouplens.grapht.reflect.Desire) operations. It can be used to remember state across invocations of a binding function as a desire chain is built up.
        Returns:
        The chain's key.

      • extend

        @Nonnull
public DesireChain extend(@Nonnull
                                   Desire d)
        Extend this chain with a new desire. The chain is not modified; this method returns a new chain that includes the new desire as its current desire.
        Parameters:
        d - The new current desire.
        Returns:
        The new desire chain.
